nodes.bodyText: When is this pool shut down? And what is the point that you do not wait until the recovery finishes?
Wait util all sgs have been recoverd. This means all sgs could get the remote schema or someone return that the schema is not exist when replayed the wal

I think this is not very friendly. Some users may want to send requests once the server is up, without noticing whether the recovery has finished, and they will feel upset when they receive failures.
It may help to add some wait and timeout, so there is less chance that the user will miss first operations.
yes, some wait will be friendly, I will add it.

Using the device node will help reduce the search path (otherwise it will search from the root node every time), so I would suggest you add the device node as a nullable parameter of MManager.updateLastCache and use it as much as possible.
And it is a little wasteful to join deviceId and measurementId using a Path. You may just use string concatenation.
How about just waiting where you created that single thread pool and shuting down it?
please log the exception and format the code
The String concat is an overhead in single node IoTDB, could we avoid this?
